18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
In 1912 my Brother and I moved to a farm in Texas. We had to pack up the old house and move everything over to Texas. We had no fence, so we had to build one. We also had to build a new house. We worked hard to make sure everything was done properly. We had to be careful not to make any mistakes. We also had to be patient and wait for the right time to move. We finally moved to Texas and started our new life there.
In 1912, my brother and I moved to a farm in Kansas. We were looking for something different from our old life.

We had no money, so we started farming. We worked hard and eventually bought our own land.

In 1914, we built a house on our new property. It was a small but comfortable home.

We lived there until 1918 when we moved back to Pennsylvania.
